title: USB Stick - Problem while booting Isos

forumNotes.author: triiui
forumNotes.content:
Hi guys.  

The idea I have over my head, is to create a booteable pendrive, with some kind of menu to be able to choose what to do. For exemple a list with few Operative Systems to install so when you enter into any option, it automatically starts to boot the instalation or the program selected.  

The problem I actually have, is that I "could" do that with Grub. I have Grub4dos installed into my pendrive. Its booteable and working perfectly, but I've been looking a lot of threads on this forum and I noticed that there are a lot of problems if you try to boot a .iso file from grub4dos.  

So now, I'm looking for another way to create this kind of menu and to successfuly start the instalation of a OS selected on that menu without any kind of problem.   

Got any ideas?

forumNotes.author: cdob
forumNotes.content:
> successfuly start the instalation of a OS selected on that menu without any kind of problem.
This would require a loadable BIOS addon.   
And this addon has to support different OS, survive a boot.  

Basically this BIOS addon creates a virtual CD drive with full BIOS support.  
A OS dosn't detect the difference to a real CD drive.  

No idea, how to create this.  

It's much more likely to adapt the ISO images to support ISO loading.

forumNotes.author: was_jaclaz
forumNotes.content:
> How can I adapt ISO files? Each, and every single .iso has it's own story. You don't adapt "a" ISO file, you don't adapt "any" ISO file. You adapt (hopefully) a single specific .ISO file. There is NO one-size-fits-all solution. Do review points #a and #d of the "common sense advice" attached to Rules: [http://www.boot-land...?act=boardrules](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?act=boardrules "External link")
